body:
I've sent a CL that ensures a failure if the reader returns `cap(b)` rather than `len(b)`.

If they hard-code an integer value between 1 and 1024 (per @justalfred's comment above), then the Validate function will still pass. I'm not sure if it's important to fail in this case, because the cap/len confusion seems more likely than a hard-coded integer value.
